text: Process the garlic, jalapeño and onion in a food processor, and cut smoothly. Place the avocado, tomatillos and salt in the processor along with these three ingredients and use a pulser to blend them until they're cut into little bits but remain husky. Take the blended mixture out of the food processor and place in a bowl. Add the cilantro, stirring this mixture until smooth. Warm a grill on your stove in between medium and high heat (you can also grill the tacos with a grill that can be used outdoors).  Combine the chili (or chipotle) powder and olive oil, and stir the combined mixture together inside a bowl that's big. Place the shrimp in the bowl along with these two ingredients (to top them). Place the shrimp on whatever grill you're using, and allow them to cook until they become luminous (approx. one and a half to two minutes for each side of the shrimp to cook). Carefully remove the shrimp from the grill once they are done cooking. Place the corn tortillas on the grill, and let them cook until they're a little parched, and flexible. On each side of the tortillas, cook them for approximately 20 seconds. Make the shrimp tacos. Start by putting some sauce on the tortillas using a spoon, then carefully add the heated shrimp. You can also add a sprout of cilantro as a topping. Allow the tacos to cool before serving.  Finished.
